intro: Goniothalamus imbricatus, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or small tree, often found in humid forest environments. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth texture and a glossy appearance. The flowers are fragrant and attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
